body_html:
Note: This isn't a bug or issue, so should not have been filed on GitHub issues.

No, EEG is not open source. It makes extensive use of some google-specific libraries for thread tracing, as well as an internal wrapper around Linux kernel tracing that would be difficult to open-source.

The trace-visualization server wouldn't be too hard to port, but somebody would have to provide all of the equivalent kernel-level context-switch traces and application-level threadpool tracing.

The trace-visualization server wouldn't be too hard to port, but somebody would have to provide all of the equivalent kernel-level context-switch traces and application-level threadpool tracing.
body:
Note: This isn't a bug or issue, so should not have been filed on GitHub issues. 

No, EEG is not open source.  It makes extensive use of some google-specific libraries for thread tracing, as well as an internal wrapper around Linux kernel tracing that would be difficult to open-source.

The trace-visualization server wouldn't be too hard to port, but somebody would have to provide all of the equivalent kernel-level context-switch traces and application-level threadpool tracing.
